tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Had a third place finish, four top-10s, nine top-25s and 13 cuts made in 15 starts on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, where he finished the year ranked 25th on the Order of Merit… Had a season best T3 at the rain-shortened Guatemala Stella Artois Open, posting rounds of 68-68-70... His other top-10s were T5 at All You Need is Ecuador Open, T8 at VISA Open de Argentina and T10 at Lexus Panama Classic… Made the cut in three of five starts on the Web.com Tour, where his best finish was T44 at the Greater Dallas Open in June... Missed the cut at the Puerto Rico Open on his only PGA TOUR start of the year. 

2014: Competing as an amateur he earned PGA TOUR Latinoamérica exempt status with a T5 finish at the Lima, Peru Q-School in January, but didn't make any starts… Starting his career as a professional finished T87 at the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December. Sandwiched second and third rounds of 65-69 around four 70-and-over scores.

2013: Entered the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament and played as an amateur. Advanced to the final stage in Southern California and finished T95. Chose to return to Los Angeles for another year at USC and did not make any Web.com Tour starts.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played college golf for the University of Southern California (USC) for three seasons, 2011-12 to 2013-14… In February 2014, won his first collegiate event, the Jones Sports Invitational at Somis, Calif., by one shot. Earned Honorable Mention All-American honors in 2014… In his only two PGA TOUR starts, finished T29 at the 2011 Farmers Insurance Open near his San Diego-area home and missed the cut at the 2011 FedEx St. Jude Classic, playing on sponsor exemptions in both events… Was an AJGA All-American from 2007-10 and played on the victorious U.S. Junior Ryder Cup team… Finished the 2010 season No. 1 in junior golf's Polo Golf Rankings… Was the 2010 Rolex Junior Player of the Year… That same year made the quarterfinals of the U.S. Amateur and was runner-up at the Junior PGA Championship… At age 14, was runner-up at the 2007 U.S. Junior Amateur.
tourBios.personal: Attended La Jolla Country Day School in La Jolla, Calif… Has one younger brother, Vincent, who plays football at Wake Forest University…Grew up in the Dallas, Texas, area competing against Jordan Spieth in junior competitions, before his family moved to Southern California…If not a professional golfer, says he would be a basketball player…Says he used to have a lot of superstitions but "not anymore"…Instagram is his favorite app and Tony Romo and Tom Brady are his favorite athletes, with Chipotle his favorite restaurant…Follows USC sports and all Dallas-area professional teams…Would round out his dream foursome with his dad, grandfather and brother…Not many people know he has an obsession with planes and would most like to trade places for a day with a fighter pilot… Twitter name is @apaoluccigolf… Instagram name is @anthony_paolucci

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T114 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T44th in 2015 at the Greater Dallas Open.
